body.name: Unigear Ski Helmet Speakers, True Wireless Stereo Snowboard Headphones with HDR Audio, Drop-in Headphones Compatible with Any Audio Ready Ski or Snowboard Helmet, Bluetooth 5.0
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 1 hr 56 mins
Or fastest pickup Wednesday, February 14. Order within 1 hr 56 mins
features: 【Proprietary hdr audio tech】 Unigear Wireless Ski Helmet Speakers make your music sound like the performer is beside you. Our HDR audio tech and 40mm high-efficiency drivers deliver a premium acoustic experience. Meanwhile, the stirring HDR tech automatically optimizes the lows and highs, providing you with flawless music. control every feature without ever removing your device from your helmet, is easy to change, play or pause tracks or take calls, and use Siri (voice control) through the button.

【True wireless & Bluetooth 5.0】 Say goodbye to the earphones that spontaneously knot themselves. The Unigear Wireless Bluetooth headphones adopt the latest Bluetooth 5.0 to maintain a stable connection within ten meters and a faster transmission speed. As a result, you can enjoy conversations and music without audio dropouts or interruptions.

【Glove-friendly button】 The Ski Helmet Speakers have an easy control button so people can accurately press the button with ski snow gloves. It allows you to control every feature without removing your device from your helmet, which makes it easy to change, play, or pause tracks, take calls, and use Siri (voice control) through the button.

【Louder music & longer battery life】Surprisingly loud, the Snowboarding Headphones help you reduce the sound of the wind. Also, it can play for 10 hours on a full battery and covers you with music all day long.

【365 days of graet satisfaction】If you have any inquiries regarding this product, please contact the Unigear customer service team. We will get back to you within 24 hours. Make sure your helmet is audio-compatible. And the earphones will effortlessly fit into your helmet slot. Compatible with the following helmets with audio insert slots: Bern, Giro, Smith, Anon, Pro-TEC, Bolle, and more.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Will these fit in Motorcycle helmets? Yes, they have microphones.You can make and answer phone calls with these. Does the charging case have batteries? No, the charging case without batteries How to turn off the headphone？ 1.Place in the charging box to turn on. 2.If not connected to any device, the headphones will automatically turn off after 5 minutes 3.Press and hold the L/R headphone button for 4 seconds, the blue light will come on with a "power off" audio cue. How to restore factory setting? Please manual power off first. Then press and hold the L/R headphone button for 10 seconds, the blue light will come down. What to do if disconnect the ski speaker? Please restore factory setting for the helmet headphones. Then follow the manual to pair your device.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Wow. Very good sound, base, impressed
reviews.reviewText: Let's just say it was worth my taking a few minutes to write this. Just charged them and inserted into my snowboard helmet. I like good sounding music, and these are really good. I held them up to my wife's ears so she could hear them. Deep base, crisp, and much much better than the cheapo version I put in my moto helmet. If I could find motorcycle speakers that sound this good in my snowboard helmet, I'll get them. Capable of much louder than I need. Very happy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Like a lot of people I bought these cause I was tired of the AirPods putting too much pressure on my ears when I wore my helmet. These are my first pair of ski helmet speakers so I don’t have much to compare it too but I really like them. As far as battery life they’re impressive. I used them from 8AM-4PM and when I got back home it was still showing 70%. I think the sound quality is great especially if you like songs with bass in them. I never maxed out the volume cause I still like to hear my surroundings when I’m on the trails. But when I tried to max it out at home I felt like it was more than enough. The buttons are great and easy to use for pausing and skipping songs. I didn’t make phone calls on the mountain so if that’s what your looking for I couldn’t tell you if you’ll be happy. Every helmet is different but I have a Smith Mission helmet and once I was able to peel the Velcro and play around with the foam padding in the ear pads the fit comfortably. I’ve seen some speakers that are connected but for me I like that these are separate. I bought the extended warranty just in case these things start to give me problems after a few uses.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Great headphones, but missing a major function
reviews.reviewText: I tried these against two of the top competitors (most expensive wireless Outdoor Tech Chips Ultra 2.0 and mid priced wired Wildhorn Alta’s).Pros: these sound amazing (much better than $229 Outdoor Tech and a little better and louder than the Wildhorn), charge via USB-C, have a good battery life and fit perfectly into my Giro helmet.Cons: no charging case like the Outdoor Tech, for additional charge on your trip or the mountain. And the biggest con…NO VOLUME CONTROL (seriously, why is this left off?!)Verdict: if you don’t care about volume control and just want play, pause to have a conversation and all the other standard functions, then these are hands down the best audio quality I’ve heard. They are a little thicker than the OT’s but they aren’t uncomfortable in my helmet. Unfortunately for me, the volume control and audio quality was most important to me, so I went with the Wildhorn and will be returning those and the OT’s.Hope you find this review helpful if you’re looking for on device volume controls, like all other helmet speakers have.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Awesome sound quality
reviews.reviewText: I have been looking for a set of stand alone Bluetooth speakers for my motorcycle half helmet and didn’t want the other styles that come with the large clip or stick on the side of the helmet like cardo etc..I’m so glad I found these, they are exactly what I was looking for and with a few modifications to my ear pads to make them fit, they sound incredible with lots of bass and waterproof to boot…Great product and I highly recommend them as an alternative to everything else that’s out there.Thank you!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely worth it!
reviews.reviewText: Writing this review for everyone who likes quality sound, and like me has looked at every helmet speaker on the internet. These speakers have bass! Do they sound as awesome as AirPods? No. They sound one step below AirPods but you don’t have to deal with the ear pain of AirPods under a ski helmet. They have plenty of bass and the sound quality is pretty darn good. I’m a sound quality snob and these, for helmet speakers, are definitely impressive. I had one phone call on them and the call sounded great too. I compared these to another highly rated and more expensive helmet speakers and these sounded much better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Does not stay connected to bluetooth
reviews.reviewText: I really wanted to love these. However, I have taken them snowboarding 3 times thinking different locations of my phone in my jacket would help. But every time after about 15 minutes, it says in my ear that the speakers has lost connection. Then a few minutes later it states it's connected. I got so annoyed with the constant chatter that I had to just take them out. Disappointed and because I couldn't troubleshoot in time the return window has closed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Shredding in Stereo
reviews.reviewText: I guess this is supposed to be a mid-grade speaker system, but they operate and sound great to me. I put them in a mid-grade Turboski Helmet and now I am shredding in stereo. It really makes my whole helmet sound like surround sound stereo. I've actually never wore a helmet in all the 20 yrs. of snowboarding but with this surround sound stereo, I enjoy my helmet very much and can't believe it took me so long to put all this together. I guess as one gets older, they seek more luxury in everyday activities.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars As a self-proclaimed audiophile, I was pleasantly surprised
reviews.reviewText: Ok, these are not Hi-Fi supreme sound quality speakers but they serve their purpose very well. I use them in my snowboard helmet and I love being able to listen to tunes while on the slopes. I had been using AirPods but the helmet pushes on them so they hurt and they make it hard to hear when I am on the lift. So far, going to these speakers has been an improvement in every way. The oversized button is great for keeping my gloves on and still being able to pause/play with just a tap. I don’t have any other helmet speakers to compare these to but I am very happy with these. I only ride for about four hours at a time and I have never run these out of battery - I am not sure how long they last on a single charge but long enough for me. I also don’t carry the charge case with me - too bulky and heavy for my pockets.

Took this out on the slopes for an 8 hour day and zero issues.Sound quality was solid, and I was able to take calls without any issues. The battery performed at -10 to -30 temps (base to summit) temps for most of the 8 hours and I didn't need to charge it.The only negative but probably a me thing is the side button is a bit sensitive. My helmet is quite tight and on some jumps and steep turns, it seemed to pause the music (registering as a click). Not a big issue as it only happened a few times and can be fixed with just a click.Enjoying these very much so a week in, will come back at the end of the season and adjust my rating based on longevity

Back story; I’ve been using ear buds under my helmet but I am tired of taking my glove off to change songs, volume etc.I bought these for $76 and was unsure how the sound would come through.Rode with them in my helmet today. Loved them!The sound quality would be 8/10 in comparison to my iPod pros. Not bad really, bass was deep, treble was high. Pretty darn good! And I do like to ride with music, and it’s gotta sound good. I rode for 4 hours, no disconnect or battery dead in -15 Celsius.No more gloves off, just tap the ear muff side of your helmet once to pause, twice on the left to go back a song, twice on the right to move forward.Tap 3 times, tell Siri volume up or down.A call came in, hold the right or left for 2 sec to ignore.These things just changed my life. I hope they up!

This is a great product for the price and its purpose. I ordered these for my son for Christmas. He wanted to use them inside his snowmobile helmet. Unfortunately we couldn’t get them to work with the helmet. The device itself is fantastic. Snowboarding helmets may have a pouch/pocket for the speakers. A snowmobile helmet does not. We tried. Sorry we have to return and keep looking for Bluetooth speakers compatible with his helmet.

I really like these little devices. They are perfect for frequency therapy sessions. I specifically use them for Scaler Wave Therapy which often requires me to put the devices on various parts of the body for best treatment results and keep the devices in place for long periods of time.Google : soundswest.com and/or Royal Raymond Rife for information on frequency therapy

I like to listen to music when I'm skiing, so I ordered a set of headphone pucks for the coming season. Upon receiving and listening, I was terribly disappointed at the quality of the sound...very tinny and little base, despite an impreasive price tag.Not so with these pucks.The sound quality is impressive. Especially the base. I'm not saying these are supper hifidelity pucks, but they do punch out an impressive amount of bass. For good bass, you need a large surface area and matching electronics to drive the lower frequencies. These guys do a good job of that. And not at the expense of the mid and upper frequencies.I also like that they are loud enough to be used outdoors. Providing good sound at high volume without interference is also a sign of quality. The manufacturer obviously had the end user in mind as helmet earpads are not acoustically insulated, so these pucks would have to work extra hard at providing quality sound at a higher energy level guven all the ambient noise.I also like that they come in a nice case.If there was anything to ccomplain about, 2 things come to mind....1) My phone earbuds come with a charging case which serves as an extra battery so my ear buds are always charged when I pull them out of the case, yet these do not. Why would you not incorporate this...especially when this case is even larger?2) The provided charging cord does not have a storage spot. Why do manufacturers not take this into account and provide a space for the cord. Someday these guys may start thinking like an end user! Arghh!The run time indicated is up to 10 hours at high volume (I did not test it), but I imagine the cold on the slopes will greatly reduce this.Overall, despite these minor nuisances, they do provide quality sound at a high volume for a relatively long time, so they will get 5 stars from me.I will continue to use these over the winter season and will update this review if my experience changes over time.
